content:
• Thursday, September 27, 2012
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -7.2%) closed lower today on news the USPTO has received a request by Google...

    Vringo (VRNG -7.2%) closed lower today on news the USPTO has received a request by Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) to re-examine the search result/ad ranking patent Vringo is suing the company over. Vringo responded with a PR declaring the USPTO's action "an initial step in a process that ordinarily takes several years," and predicting it won't delay Vringo's trial with Google, set to begin on Oct. 16. Vringo also filed its opposition today to a Google motion for a summary judgement ahead of the trial (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • AZZ

    AZZ (NYSE:AZZ) declares $0.14/share quarterly dividend. Forward yield 1.61%. For shareholders of...

    AZZ (NYSE:AZZ) declares $0.14/share quarterly dividend. Forward yield 1.61%. For shareholders of record Oct 12. Payable Oct 26. Ex-div date Oct 10. Shares +9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • AZZ

    AZZ (NYSE:AZZ): Q2 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $153.4M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $7M....

    AZZ (NYSE:AZZ): Q2 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $153.4M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) -3.4% AH after announcing Time Warner Cable (TWC) will sell 46.4M Class A...

    Clearwire (CLWR) -3.4% AH after announcing Time Warner Cable (TWC) will sell 46.4M Class A shares (3.2% of total outstanding shares and 7.8% of Class A shares) through a public offering. TWC had already disclosed its intent to sell the stake - investors could be disappointed other Clearwire shareholders didn't exercise their option to buy part or all of it.Â  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • BGCP

    BGC Partners (NASDAQ:BGCP) ups its Q3 guidance, expecting distributable earnings revenues at the...

    BGC Partners (NASDAQ:BGCP) ups its Q3 guidance, expecting distributable earnings revenues at the high-end of its previously announced range of $415-$450M. Pre-tax distributable earnings are expected at the mid-point of the previously announced $41-$52M range. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • NKE

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 EPS of $1.23 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $6.67B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $260M....

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 EPS of $1.23 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $6.67B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $260M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ2 EPS of -$0.27 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $2.87B (-31% Y/Y) beats...

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ2 EPS of -$0.27 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $2.87B (-31% Y/Y) beats by $370M. 7.4M BlackBerry shipments, 130K PlayBooks. Shares +14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 39 Comments
  • STX

    A "highly reliable source close to Seagate" tells Eric Savitz Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) isn't going...

    A "highly reliable source close to Seagate" tells Eric Savitz Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) isn't going to buy OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.4%). OCZ, which was up over 10% earlier today on a report from The Register suggesting a deal came close this summer, has given back most of those gains. Between The Register's report and a July BSN scoop that proved to be inaccurate, someone feeding OCZ buyout rumors might have a very active imagination. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • ESLT

    Vision Systems International, a joint venture between Elbit Systems (ESLT +5%) and Rockwell...

    Vision Systems International, a joint venture between Elbit Systems (ESLT +5%) and Rockwell Collins (COL +2.5%), has been awarded a contract from the Royal Danish Air Force to provide its Helmet Mounted Night Vision Cueing and Display-Aviator's Night Vision Imaging Systems technology/ the night module for the Joint Helmet Mounted Cueing System.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM

  • The cure for low prices is low prices. Left for dead a few months back, natural gas soars today...

    The cure for low prices is low prices. Left for dead a few months back, natural gas soars today to its highest price this year as the multi-year collapse in working rig counts looks to finally be taking effect. UNG +3%. The double-levered oil & gas ETF (DIG), +30.1% in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 12 Comments
  • BKD

    Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +6.4%) shares are riding high after Bloomberg says the company...

    Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +6.4%) shares are riding high after Bloomberg says the company could be the next takeover target in the senior living space. BKD has the group's lowest valuation relative to cash flow, and operating margin is projected to reach a record high next quarter, Bloomberg calculates. Its stock price "doesn’t really reflect the improving fundamentals," an analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 5 Comments
  • CPHD

    Goldman says Cepheid (CPHD -8.3%) is oversold, and the pullback may be a buying opportunity. The...

    Goldman says Cepheid (CPHD -8.3%) is oversold, and the pullback may be a buying opportunity. The firm says that despite the gloomy FY13 margin forecast, the company has a "healthy" long-term growth story. Its a leader in the rapid MDx market, and has a solid new prduct pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • NXPI

    More on JPMorgan's NXP (NXPI +6.9%) report: Analyst Harlan Sur writes NXP has two iPhone 5...

    More on JPMorgan's NXP (NXPI +6.9%) report: Analyst Harlan Sur writes NXP has two iPhone 5 design wins - it's providing an interface chip for Apple's new Lightning connector to go with the display interface chip mentioned in iSuppli's teardown. Sur thinks each win should produce $200M-$250M in revenue over a 3-year period, and that the chipmaker's Q3 and Q4 estimates have little or no downside risk. But he still rates NXP a Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (PRGS +12.2%) soars after posting its FQ3 report. Though results were mixed -...

    Progress Software (PRGS +12.2%) soars after posting its FQ3 report. Though results were mixed - EPS of $0.31 beat by $0.07, but revenue of $107.2M (-14% Y/Y) missed by $5.1M - the BPM software provider guided for FQ4 constant currency Y/Y revenue growth of -2% to +1% for its core ops - that's likely a little better than a consensus for an 8.2% total revenue drop in actual dollars.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • XOMA

    XOMA (XOMA +7.1%) says its partner, Servier has begun phase 3 clinical trials of of Gevokizumab...

    XOMA (XOMA +7.1%) says its partner, Servier has begun phase 3 clinical trials of of Gevokizumab in several European countries. The study is intended to test the efficacy and safety of the drug in the treatment of patients with BehÃ§et's Disease uveitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo's (TIVO +3.3%) good week gets better after the company announces U.S. cable provider...

    TiVo's (TIVO +3.3%) good week gets better after the company announces U.S. cable provider Mediacom will offer the company's costly whole-home solutions - both gateway DVRs and software - starting in early 2013. TiVo rallies earlier this week thanks to a huge patent settlement with AT&T and a Lazard upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • GE

    General Electric (GE +2%) raises its outlook for industrial organic growth to 10% at it's...

    General Electric (GE +2%) raises its outlook for industrial organic growth to 10% at it's Infrastructure Investor Meeting. (Webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 6 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +3.8%) gains after officially launching 4 desktop processors based on its delayed...

    AMD (AMD +3.8%) gains after officially launching 4 desktop processors based on its delayed Trinity architecture. The chips are somewhat power-hungry, but also aggressively priced ($53-$122) relative to Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) low-end Ivy Bridge parts, evidence AMD is willing to sacrifice margins to keep its market share from falling further. Reviews indicate only a modest CPU performance gain over the prior-gen Llano architecture (Intel maintains an edge here), but a healthy increase in graphics performance. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS +3.1%) and Mattress Firm (MFRM +0.8%) trade higher in the wake of an...

    Select Comfort (SCSS +3.1%) and Mattress Firm (MFRM +0.8%) trade higher in the wake of an announcement that Tempur-Pedic and Sealy will merge. It's not the deal premium that's bringing in buyers (it was small), but the prospect that the pricing environment in the sector could improve that is helping to lift the stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +3.8%) powers higher after yesterday's signing of an agreement with Sunoco...

    Range Resources (RRC +3.8%) powers higher after yesterday's signing of an agreement with Sunoco Logistics Partners (SXL +0.3%) to become an anchor shipper on the Mariner East pipeline project that will interconnect Marcellus Shale natural gas liquids resources to SXL's existing infrastructure and international port at the Marcus Hook facility near Philadelphia.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • STRM

    Streamline Health Solutions (STRM +12.7%) breaks out to a new 52-week high this morning -...

    Streamline Health Solutions (STRM +12.7%) breaks out to a new 52-week high this morning - possibly spurred on by more insider buying - as it continues its scorching +210% run higher that began in early May.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CTC

    Midday top 10 gainers: CTC +71.53%. OTC:ROYL +31.38%. APPY +18.48%. TPX +16.5%. ULTR +15.6%. WZE...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CTC +71.53%. OTC:ROYL +31.38%. APPY +18.48%. TPX +16.5%. ULTR +15.6%. WZE +13.09%. STRM +12.7%. IGLD +12.62%. PNX +11.22%. PRAN +11.17%.
    Top 10 Losers: PPHM -35.54%. OTCPK:CAFI -12.94%. SYUT -10.64%. CPHD -9.58%. MTE -9.02%. MITK -8.92%. CHYR -8%. CYTX -7.76%. FUL -7.37%. UBNT -7.07%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TIBX

    FBN shows its love of big data plays, launching coverage on Tibco (TIBX +2%), Splunk (SPLK...

    FBN shows its love of big data plays, launching coverage on Tibco (TIBX +2%), Splunk (SPLK +4.1%), Informatica (INFA +2.4%), and Actuate (BIRT +8%) at Outperform. FBN likes Tibco's 30%+ license bookings growth, and talks up the potential of its Spotfire big data analytics platform (20% of revenue). Checks indicate Spotfire is more enterprise-ready than rival solutions from QLIK and Tableau, and that Tibco's co-marketing efforts are paying off. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • NXPI

    NXP (NXPI +7.5%) jumps following a bullish JPMorgan note that mentions the chipmaker's iPhone 5...

    NXP (NXPI +7.5%) jumps following a bullish JPMorgan note that mentions the chipmaker's iPhone 5 design win. Earlier this week, iSuppli's iPhone 5 teardown revealed an NXP LCD interface chip. Some NXP investors were previously disappointed the phone doesn't feature an NFC chip, given NXP's leading position in the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • BAK

    Brazil-based Braskem (BAK -6.4%) is downgraded to Neutral at Credit Suisse, which says the...

    Brazil-based Braskem (BAK -6.4%) is downgraded to Neutral at Credit Suisse, which says the market may look at BAK differently because of a setback in basic petrochemicals, which make up ~25% of sales. Prices and spreads have dropped 15%-48% Q/Q for many products, which could derail the healthy trends seen in the resin business, CS says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • X

    Moody's cuts its steel industry outlook to negative from stable, expecting continued weak demand...

    Moody's cuts its steel industry outlook to negative from stable, expecting continued weak demand for U.S. steel and rising imports. "While capacity utilization levels remain above 70%, they have slowed since peaking in April 2012 and will likely continue at lower levels," Moody's notes. X -0.9%, AKS -1.2%, NUE +0.2%, MT -1.8%, STLD -0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • REXX

    Rexx Energy (REXX +3.4%) rises after announcing initial production results from its first Ohio...

    Rexx Energy (REXX +3.4%) rises after announcing initial production results from its first Ohio Utica Shale well. The Brace #1H well averaged a five-day sales rate, assuming full ethane recovery, of 1,008 boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling (PACD +2.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $12.50 target price at Dahlman...

    Pacific Drilling (PACD +2.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $12.50 target price at Dahlman Rose, which says PACD is a pure-play ultra-deepwater driller with one of the world's youngest and most capable fleets. The UDW market "has tightened considerably and has been effectively running at 100% utilization since the middle of 2011," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • FUL

    H.B. Fuller (FUL -4.9%) slides after reporting a largely in-line FQ3, but cutting FY guidance...

    H.B. Fuller (FUL -4.9%) slides after reporting a largely in-line FQ3, but cutting FY guidance yesterday. Net profit surged as the paint and adhesive maker benefited from restructuring efforts and a 38% jump in total revenue across all regions. But the company lowered its full-year revenue estimate to a range of $1.875B to $1.9B, down from its previous outlook of $1.93B to $1.98B, citing a slight slowdown in the industrial adhesives end markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -1.1%) slip lower as late chatter yesterday that Richard Schulze lined...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -1.1%) slip lower as late chatter yesterday that Richard Schulze lined up funding for a LBO starts to peter out. A report from the Minneapolis Star Tribune tips p-e firm Leonard Green and the sovereign wealth fund of Qatar as potential partners for Schulze.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +3.8%) rallies after announcing deals with PNM Resources (NYSE:PNM) to build 4...

    First Solar (FSLR +3.8%) rallies after announcing deals with PNM Resources (NYSE:PNM) to build 4 New Mexico solar plants that will provide 20MW of capacity. Also, the company has hired energy industry vet Bruce Yang to be the managing director for its Chinese ops. The Chinese solar market has been growing quickly, though most of its demand has been handled by local vendors.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM) jumps 11.4% after saying its proprietary HuCNS-SC neural stem cells have been...

    StemCells (STEM) jumps 11.4% after saying its proprietary HuCNS-SC neural stem cells have been transplanted into a patient with an incomplete spinal cord injury - and thereby retains some functionionality - for the first time. Earlier this month, StemCells said two out of three patients with complete injuries enjoyed restored sensation after receiving the company's stem cells. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • RIOT

    AspenBio (APPY +4.3%) intends to start a pivotal trial of its AppyScore blood-based appendicitis...

    AspenBio (APPY +4.3%) intends to start a pivotal trial of its AppyScore blood-based appendicitis test in Q4 after receiving feedback from the FDA. With the diagnostic-product developer's increased focus on AppyScore, four out of nine board members have stepped down. While AspenBio plans to appoint new directors, it also intends to ultimately maintain a smaller board. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +7.4%) soars after reaffirming 2012 guidance originally published...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +7.4%) soars after reaffirming 2012 guidance originally published in its Q2 earnings release. ANR also announces a public offering of $500M senior notes. Other coal names also move higher: JRCC +5.2%, ACI +4.4%, BTU +3.9%, CNX +3.5%, WLT +3.2%, YZC +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • GT

    Shares of Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +5.3%) rally after Goldman Sachs upgrades the company to a...

    Shares of Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +5.3%) rally after Goldman Sachs upgrades the company to a Buy rating with the firm's trends improving in North America and Europe. Analysts with Goldman say they see a better profit profile for the name, a view that falls in line with SA author Qineqt's stance that the tire industry is setting up for high profits with raw materials costs falling.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    IMAX (IMAX +4%) tracks higher after the company lands an upgrade from analysts at Susquehanna to...

    IMAX (IMAX +4%) tracks higher after the company lands an upgrade from analysts at Susquehanna to Positive from Neutral. The company's aggressive pace of installations shows no sign of slowing, but for that matter neither do earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • NWE

    NorthWestern Corp. (NYSE:NWE) -2.4% premarket as the electricity and natural gas provider cuts...

    NorthWestern Corp. (NYSE:NWE) -2.4% premarket as the electricity and natural gas provider cuts its full-year earnings guidance by $0.12/share after a judge issued an unfavorable initial ruling related to the recovery of contracted costs for its Montana plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +40.6% premarket after reaffirming plans to develop ~100K acres of land...

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +40.6% premarket after reaffirming plans to develop ~100K acres of land immediately adjacent to Great Bear Petroleum's test wells; Great Bear's CEO says "with absolute confidence that where we thought we would find oil in these source rocks, we found oil."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures shake off mainly worse-than-expected economic data, including Q2...

    Market preview: U.S. futures shake off mainly worse-than-expected economic data, including Q2 GDP 3rd estimate and durable goods, to remain firmly higher, with the S&P benchmark +0.4%. Rallying shares in Europe and China after the latter's record liquidity injection into the banking system are helping to keep sentiment positive. Later: Pending Home Sales, Kansas City Fed Mfg Survey
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • TPX

    Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) roars to a 14.2% gain in premarket action as traders latch on to the...

    Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) roars to a 14.2% gain in premarket action as traders latch on to the synergistic possibilities that could flow out of its purchase of Sealy (ZZ). At $30.63, shares trade right at where they began the week before the sector sold off.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) +3.6% after The Register reports the company indeed held buyout...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) +3.6% after The Register reports the company indeed held buyout talks with Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) this summer, with a deal "almost done on the financial side," but that talks fell apart because OCZ CEO Ryan Peterson wanted a seat on Seagate's board. Peterson's role in the deal's collapse is said to have contributed to his resignation last week. If Seagate is interested, it might have to pay less now - OCZ plunged to new multi-year lows yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • ROYL

    Premarket gainers: OTC:ROYL +38.46%. TPX +14.53%. THO +8.63%. ACHN +6.53%.Losers: PPHM -23%.

    Premarket gainers: OTC:ROYL +38.46%. TPX +14.53%. THO +8.63%. ACHN +6.53%.
    Losers: PPHM -23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • MON

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) +1.5% premarket after Wells Fargo upgrades shares to Outperform with a...

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) +1.5% premarket after Wells Fargo upgrades shares to Outperform with a $104-$106 target price range, up from $82-$84: "With Chinese glyphosate challenges seemingly well behind them, we expect MON to benefit from higher seed pricing (up 5-10% in FY2013) and penetration in Latin America (through the introduction of double and triple stacked traits)."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • DFS

    More on Discover (NYSE:DFS): Q3 net income fell 3.4% Y/Y. Card sales volume +4%. Total loans...

    More on Discover (NYSE:DFS): Q3 net income fell 3.4% Y/Y. Card sales volume +4%. Total loans +9%. Net interest margin +18 bps, thanks to lower funding costs (credit card yield fell 19 bps). Delinquencies and charge-offs hit historic lows of 1.81% and 2.43% respectively. About 10M shares repurchased for total of $350M; float fell 1.9% Y/Y. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACHN

    Achillion (ACHN +6.5%) discloses positive proof-of-concept results for ACH-3102 for treating...

    Achillion (ACHN +6.5%) discloses positive proof-of-concept results for ACH-3102 for treating chronic hepatitis C viral infections (HCV). The company has now initiated a phase II study for the drug. Achillion is hosting an analyst day today, with a live Webcast beginning at 1:00 pm ET.Â  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS): FQ3 EPS of $1.21 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $2B beats by...

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS): FQ3 EPS of $1.21 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $2B beats by $100M. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) rises 1.5% premarket amidst a (hardly surprising) Bloomberg report the company...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) rises 1.5% premarket amidst a (hardly surprising) Bloomberg report the company - burning through about $300M/month - may be considering eliminating its annual dividend payment this year. A Nokia spokesman declined to comment on the idea. The dividend announcement is typically made as part of the Q4 earnings report, which will come in January.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 11 Comments
  • TPX

    More on the Tempur-Pedic (TPX +5.4%) / Sealy (ZZ) deal - Tempur-Pedic is paying $229M to acquire...

    More on the Tempur-Pedic (TPX +5.4%) / Sealy (ZZ) deal - Tempur-Pedic is paying $229M to acquire Sealy, although the whole transaction is valued at $1.3B including the Sealy debt that Tempur-Pedic has agreed to assume or repay. Having ended at $2.14 yesterday, Sealy shares spiked 10% earlier but have settled down a bit and are +4.2% to $2.23, above TPX's offer price of $2.20.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is downgraded to Sell with price target of $14 at Jefferies, which cites the...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is downgraded to Sell with price target of $14 at Jefferies, which cites the usual concerns about the PC business and a too-slow transition to services. "Also, we believe H-P will aggressively attack the smartphone and tablet markets, which we believe are risky investments." Shares -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • TPX

    Sealy (ZZ): FQ3 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $365.4M (+9.4% Y/Y) beats by $21M....

    Sealy (ZZ): FQ3 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $365.4M (+9.4% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM

  • The pound spikes vs. the dollar following news that the U.K. economy was not as bad as...

    The pound spikes vs. the dollar following news that the U.K. economy was not as bad as previously thought in Q2 and may even have shown growth. Cable +0.3% to $1.6212. The euro's -0.2% to $1.2852, probably not helped by a report of a bailout for another Spanish region and more anti-austerity protests in Madrid.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 AM

  • EU shares rally following steep losses yesterday, boosted by China's stock recovery and ahead of...

    EU shares rally following steep losses yesterday, boosted by China's stock recovery and ahead of Spain's budget announcement. However, end-of-quarter window dressing could make trading choppy. EU Stoxx 50 +0.5%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.5%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Madrid +0.45%, Milan +0.5%. Spanish 10-year yields -6 bps to 6.02%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 AM
